content.p: Both the soap requests and the soap responses may be viewed independently. The response window is visible by default.

tr.td: Show the request window and hide the response window. Some requests will be generated by running processes, not the user. When eventing is active, the event requests will be appended to the display to prevent overwriting the user's request data.

Show the response window and hide the request window.
Note: Clicking the 'show events' button will cause the current response text to be overwritten with event data. Likewise, any new responses from the soap service (except events) will overwrite the event data with the new response text.

content.p:
Themes The request and response windows both use the White color theme by default, but may have other color themes applied independently. To change the theme, select one of the themes listed in the Theme dropdown list.
Theme changes only affect the currently displayed window. This allows the user to set different themes for the request and response windows.
The theme settings are not persistent. Each time the utility is loaded it will use the default theme setting (White) for both the request and response windows.
